comments:
My working environment:
   Linux:  version 2.6.5-7.109.5-default (geeko@buildhost) (gcc version 3.3.3
(SuSE Linux)) #1 Fri Oct 22 12:55:06 UTC 2004
   Eclipse:version: 3.1.0 Build id: 200411050810
   VE:     version 1.0.1 installed from the menu item SoftwareUpdates of Eclipse.

   Running env info:
           eclipse.buildId=I200411050810
           java.version=1.4.2_06
           java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
           BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US
           Command-line arguments: -wmargs -Xmx512M


   When opening a visual class, there is no SWT control palette in the palette menu.
   The following error message comes from error log:
java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError: IWAV0135E
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError(org/eclipse/swt/internal/gtk/GdkEventMotion)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.BasicAllocationProcesser.instantiateWithString(BasicAllocationProcesser.java:203)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.BeanProxyAdapter.basicInitializationStringAllocation(BeanProxyAdapter.java:885)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.BeanProxyAdapter.primInstantiateBeanProxy(BeanProxyAdapter.java:861)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.BeanProxyAdapter.instantiateBeanProxy(BeanProxyAdapter.java:755)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.CompositionProxyAdapter.initSetting(CompositionProxyAdapter.java:158)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.core.CompositionProxyAdapter.initBeanProxy(CompositionProxyAdapter.java:119)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart$Setup.run(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:1488)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)
        ...
        (more error messages)

   I installed same VE on the same version Eclipse on the Windows XP and the SWT
palette of VE works.

Check out Bug 71730, there's a link in there that explains you have to add the
swt.jar etc as a Library and NOT just as External JARs to your project.

Helped me HTH you :-)

The swt.jar had been in my project library path. The same project works with VE 
on windows XP

It's possible that some changes to SWT on GTK in 3.1 causes problems with the VE
(the VE hasn't been stepped up to support 3.1 yet).  Have you tried running it
on Eclipse 3.0.1 on Linux/GTK?

I just tried Eclipse 3.0.1 with 
   EMF SDK 2.0.1
   GEF SDK 3.0.1
   VE 1.0.1
and got same problem.

I fixed two library path problems for swt-pi.jar and swt-pi-gtk-3111.so and it
looked better than before, but SWT still not working. I got error message as
following:

    ?The command 'org.eclipse.ui.edit.delete' is not defined, but is being asked
if it is active.  Are you using an actionDefinitionId without defining a command??
Additional Comment #5 is for VE on Eclipse 3.1

I just tried this with :
  eclipse-SDK-3.0.1-linux-gtk.zip
  emf-sdo-runtime-2.0.1.zip
  GEF-runtime-3.0.1.zip
  VE-SDK-1.0.1.1.zip
and everything worked fine.

The SWT JARS should not be manually added, but should be done by through the Add
Library in the project's Java Build Path. The added container should have the
JARs  swt.jar, swt-pi.jar and swt-mozilla.jar. 

Could you please verify this and close the defect if it does not occur. VE and
its pre-requisites can be found at:
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/ve/downloads/index.php

As discussed please add the SWT Library to the classpath from the properties of
the Java project, instead of manually adding the JARs. Please reopen the defect
if the problem persists.
